intro: Erythrochlamys kelleri, commonly known as the Keller's red chlamys, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often blue-green in color. Erythrochlamys kelleri is relatively rare and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
